Platform.Title: EGD-e microarray platform
Platform.Manufacture-Protocol:
Listeria monocytogenes The Listeria monocytogenes genome microarray consists of 6347 70-mer oligonucleotides representing ORFs from:
Listeria monocytogenes - strain EGD-e Listeria monocytogenes - strain 4b F2365 Listeria monocytogenes - strain 1/2a F6854 Listeria monocytogenes - strain 4b H7858 printed on amino-silane Nexterion A Schott slides
Platform.Description: Note that the ID number given is the product of the TIGR ID and the sum of (block+column+row).

Column.Name: Block
Column.Description: Indicates which 17x17 block oligonucleotide is located (total of 48 blocks)

Column.Name: Row
Column.Description: Indicates the row in a given block that the oligonucleotide is located

Column.Name: Column
Column.Description: Indicates the column in a given block that the oligonucleotide is located

Column.Name: Chip_ID
Column.Description: NTorf number assigned by TIGR

Column.Name: TIGR_ID
Column.Description: ID number given by TIGR file

Column.Name: ORF
Column.Description: Gene_name: lmo number given by ListiList website

Column.Name: Common_name
Column.Description: annotated gene function or name

Sample.Title: 10_15_04 BHI RT1 EGDe vs ∆mogR
Sample.Description: RNA was harvested from 24hr cultures grown at RT lying flat in 10mL BHI.

Series.Title: MogR regulon in response to temperature and growth condition
Series.Summary: Microarray analyses comparing the transcriptional profile of wild-type EGDe relative to ∆mogR (L. monocytogenes) during growth at 37˚C and RT in BHI broth and during intracellular growth inside J774 host cells at 37˚C. These analyses revealed that MogR primarily functions to repress flagellar motility genes during growth at 37˚C. Keywords: EGDe vs ∆mogR, Temperature, Growth condition
Series.Overall-Design: Oligonucleotide spotted arrays obtained from the Pathogen Functional Genomic Resource Center at TIGR were used for competitive hybridization studies comparing the transcriptional profile of wild-type EGDe to ∆mogR (L. monocytogenes). A minimum of two technical replicates with associated dye swaps was performed for each growth condition. 14 samples were analyzed, comprising 9 biological replicates; dye swaps were performed for 6 of the biological replicates.
